definition: owner/master/host/individual or party concerned/God/Lord/main/to indicate or signify/trump card (in card games)
hero (of a novel or film)/main protagonist
master (of the house)/main character in a novel etc/hero or heroine
heroine (of a novel or film)/main female protagonist
lit. when one beats a dog, one must answer to its master (idiom)/fig. before punishing sb, one should consider how that would affect others associated with him
pinyin: da3 gou3 hai2 dei3 kan4 zhu3 ren2

sentences.english: Never far from her work, the mistress of the web patiently waits.
sentences.chinese: 蛛網的女主人永遠守在自己的作品邊，耐心的等候。

sentences.english: My master went back to his friends and we took the boat out to sea.
sentences.chinese: 主人回到他的朋友們那兒去了，我們坐船出了海。

sentences.english: For man is man or master of his fate.
sentences.chinese: 人根本那是人，是自己命運的主人。

sentences.english: Both owners and pets in the dog-walking group had lost weight.
sentences.chinese: 遛狗那組的主人和寵物們都瘦了一些。

sentences.english: He acts as if he owned the place.
sentences.chinese: 他的舉止行爲就好像他是那個地方的主人。

sentences.english: A hostess apologized to her guest for serving a pie without any cheese.
sentences.chinese: 女主人爲餡餅裏沒放奶酪向客人道歉。

sentences.english: In 1960 Khruschev headed a delegation to visit Indonesia and was royally treated by his host.
sentences.chinese: 率團出訪印度尼西亞，他受到了主人的盛情款待。

sentences.english: He plays the novel's rakish hero.
sentences.chinese: 他扮演小說中放蕩的主人公。

sentences.english: The owners of these experiences recognize them as fragmentary semimemories.
sentences.chinese: 這些過往經歷的主人把它們當作是零碎的半記憶片段。

sentences.english: "O Lord, God of my master, Abraham," he prayed.
sentences.chinese: “耶和華我主人亞伯拉罕的神阿，”他禱告說。

sentences.english: You can- not serve two masters; you must serve one or the other.
sentences.chinese: 你不能侍奉兩個主人，你必須擇一而從。

sentences.english: The flying hornbill represents our home state, Sarawak, taking us from Borneo to the host country, China, which is represented by the panda.
sentences.chinese: 犀鳥代表我們故鄉砂拉越，以及熊貓代表主人家中國。

sentences.english: This probably can save the owner a lot of money instead of applying one-off colouring.
sentences.chinese: 這種行爲比起一次性染色倒是可以給主人省下很多錢。

sentences.english: Then said the king to Ziba, Behold, thine are all that pertained unto Mephibosheth.
sentences.chinese: 王問說，你主人的兒子在哪裏呢。

sentences.english: As is well known, we students are the future masters of the nation.
sentences.chinese: 如衆所周知，我們學生都是國家未來的主人翁。

definition: (neologism) (coll.) pet owner (lit. "official in charge of cleaning up poop")
Master (term used by servant)/Your Majesty/operator (of machine)
